**The Supreme Cavern-Real Scripture of the Nine Crimson Talismans and the Five Emperors’ Inner Realms**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Cavern-Real Scripture of the Nine Crimson Talismans and the Five Emperors’ Inner Realms* (abbreviated as *The Nine Crimson Talismans*). Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Shangqing tradition. One fascicle. Base text from *The Orthodox Daoist Canon*, Zhengyi Section, First Division.

---

**The Supreme Cavern-Real Scripture of the Nine Crimson Talismans and the Five Emperors’ Inner Realms**

The Nine Crimson Talismans, also called the *Nine Aerial Talismans of the Feathered Central Grove*, were concealed by the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning within the Golden Chamber and Jade Abode of the Jasper Terrace of Supreme Clarity. Their divine radiance blazes forth, streaming light that illumines the void; the Four Poles oversee their trial, and the Five Emperors guard their authenticity.

The Supreme Lord appointed three hundred Jade Lads of the Cloud Palace, while the Upper Prime further assigned seven hundred Jade Maidens of the Western Florescence to attend and preserve this numinous writ. Its divine standard marks Supreme Clarity, its majesty commands the Nine Heavens; it subdues demons and dispels defilement, beheads legions of malevolence, seals and governs the sacred mountains, summons and commands the spirits of waters. It oversees boundless multitudes, encompasses the myriad immortals, and with the Five Peaks, the Four Abysses, and the bodies of later disciples, it deploys divine soldiers to punish transgressions and reward merit.

Every nine thousand years, the Nine Heavens open once; when the Nine Heavens open, this scripture illuminates the chambers of the Five Peaks, mysteriously bestowed upon those who attain the Dao. Without immortal bones or jade names inscribed for future lives, none may behold its passages. Those who obtain its text become masters and patriarchs of the Five Peaks, sovereigns of the Four Seas. Those who uphold it bring blessings to the souls of seven generations of ancestors and spread fortune to nine kinds of kin. Those who cultivate it ascend to become lofty immortals of Supreme Clarity.

The Nine Crimson Talismans are the flying, mysterious feathered chapters of the *qi* of the Nine Primes, coalesced into jade script. The primordial text was transmitted by the human realm to the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao; the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning transmitted it to the Upper Prime Lord of the Southern Culmen; the Supreme Lord transmitted it to the Great Emperor of Fusang; the Great Emperor transmitted it to the Celestial Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity; the Celestial Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity transmitted it to the Later Sage Emperor of the Golden Portals; and thence to the Prime Minister, the Azure Lad. The Upper Prime Lord of the Southern Culmen transmitted it to Master Hongya and the Four Perfected of the Great Ultimate.

Transmission of *qi* follows in succession, each inscribed on golden tablets, bound with purple cords, encased in cloud-brocade satchels, sealed with the seals of the Three Primes, stored in dark and verdant caskets, and concealed within the chambers of the Nine Bends. Jade immortals offer incense, Mount Taihua holds the towels; the Four Directors oversee its radiance, the Five Emperors guard its carriage. The Three Primes observe the rites, the myriad immortals pay homage to the Perfected. Its Dao is most wondrous; according to the regulations, it is transmitted once every seven thousand years. To lightly divulge or expose it, or transmit it to the unworthy, brings the seven generations of ancestors to trial and causes the disciple’s body to perish in the river’s source.

Later disciples who diligently concentrate their minds, seek immortality with utmost sincerity, and resonate with the dark virtue of the Great Void, aligning with the mysterious emergence of the Three Primes, will naturally encounter and obtain this text. Only upon receiving and wearing the true talismans may one traverse the mysterious peaks, entrust one’s body to the secluded mountains, command the Nine Crimson to seal the mounds, summon the Five Agents to invoke spirits, dispatch the Water Emperor to erase transgressions, and gather the numina of the seas to open the sources. Thus, the ledgers of sins are obliterated in the Nine Treasuries, and the records of life are inscribed in the Three Clarities. *Qi* shakes the dark waves, majesty subdues the myriad spirits; demonic hosts are vanquished in trial, immortal officials descend in form. Wielding the tally of the Six Jia, one commands the celestial soldiers; penetrating the obscure and fathoming the subtle, one perceives the yet-unborn. Thus may one attain divine transcendence and soar through Supreme Clarity.

Those who study without encountering the *Nine Aerial Talismans of the Feathered Central Grove* will not receive the mysterious names of the Five Peaks, nor will the water spirits of the Four Seas erase their ledgers of sins or inscribe their names in the Three Clarities. When wandering through rivers and marshes or dwelling in secluded mountains without wearing this text, mountain spirits and celestial demons will test and thwart their aspirations, myriad harms will arise of themselves, and they will never attain immortality. The Water Emperor will compile their transgressions and present them to the Emperor of Judgment.

**The Five Peaks’ Five Emperors’ Inner Method of Transforming True Forms to Seek Immortality**

If upon closing the eyes one immediately perceives his true form, that person’s five palaces will coalesce *qi*, the six viscera will generate the Perfected, the nine treasuries will become luminously clear, and internally, no obstructions will remain. Harmonious tones will resound, and wondrous principles will become lucid and penetrating—such a person possesses the talent of a superior immortal. Thus, the Dao will descend at once, and divine luminaries will respond in resonance; such a one will attain immortality without delay.

If one sees azure *qi* flourishing and dense, it is the *qi* of the upright spirit of that direction, reflecting in emptiness—this indicates gradual progress on the Dao. If one sees black *qi*, it is the office of the Perfected of one’s original life reflecting in emptiness, overseeing the trial of one’s body. If one sees red *qi*, it is the *qi* of the office of cavernous generation reflecting in emptiness, coming to guard one’s body. If one sees yellow *qi*, it is the *qi* of the office dispatched by the Peak reflecting in emptiness, coming to assist one in communicating with the Perfected. None of these should be feared; proceed according to the original method, and in time, the Dao will naturally respond and descend.

If one sees white *qi*, it is the essence of celestial demons in the void, coming to test one’s body. One should strike the left teeth thirty-six times and recite the *Golden Mystery Chapter* once; then the demonic essence will vanish of itself, and the Perfected will naturally descend.

If upon closing the eyes one immediately perceives his true form, that person’s bones will coalesce jade frost, *qi* will interpenetrate the divine palace, the cinnabar terrace will inscribe the tablets, and the purple chapters will be bound into records. Profoundly awakened to the dark path, one roams freely in the empty courtyard, encounters all things without obstruction, and through tranquil contemplation, resonates with the Perfected—such a person possesses the talent of a superior immortal. **The Supreme Method of Inscribing Names in the Five Marchmounts to Determine Immortal Rank**
*The Nine Vermilion Talismans for Pacifying the Marchmounts and Seeking Immortal Rank*

**The Nine Qi Rank Talisman of the Azure Emperor of the Eastern Marchmount, with Inner Visualization of Jia-Yi Entering Wood**

The Azure Emperor Lord of the East, surnamed Chang, personal name Jingmeng, wears the Nine Origins Heaven-Penetrating Crown upon his head. His robe is of azure brocade with jade-green flying skirts, and he bears the Supreme Nine Qi Life-Spirit Seal. His sash is woven of kingfisher plumes and interlaced with numinous cords.

On the day of *Lichun* (Beginning of Spring), he rides a cloud-chariot drawn by nine azure dragons, accompanied by twelve Jade Maidens of the Azure Waist, each holding a nine-colored staff and banner of the Azure Grove. He traverses the Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai, reviewing the registers of Perfected Ones and Immortal Officials. At times, he visits the Water Emperor of the Eastern Sea to audit the merits, transgressions, and sins of those who study the Dao. Upon his return, he descends to bestow talismans upon the adept’s body.

The practitioner ingests this talisman to summon his presence, visualizes his *qi* to induce the descent of his Perfected form, and seeks to have their name expunged from the Water Emperor’s ledgers and inscribed in the Jade Registers.

On the day of *Lichun* at dawn, bathe, purify, and enter the chamber to burn incense. Ingest the *Nine Qi Rank Talisman of Jia-Yi Entering Wood*, strike the teeth nine times, and visualize the Azure Emperor Lord of the East: surnamed Chang, personal name Jingmeng, clad in his robes and colors, descending in his azure-cloud chariot into the adept’s chamber. Azure *qi* billows densely, filling the room and encircling the adept’s form.

Within the Azure Emperor’s *qi*, visualize a crimson radiance transforming, like the essence of Jupiter, blazing and luminous. It descends from the crown of the head into the adept’s body, its brilliance illuminating the liver. Draw in the *qi* and swallow nine times, sensing warmth suffusing the body. Soon, the crimson light scatters within and emerges from the nine orifices, coalescing above the adept’s head into azure clouds. The adept feels their body within the clouds, ascending with them.

After a long while, the perception stabilizes, as if treading empty space. Then recite the incantation while looking upward:

*"Supreme Cinnabar, myriad purifications,
Revolving to seal the nine gates.
Mysterious Void uplifts the Perfected,
Crimson ranks swiftly divide.
Bearing Jia to enter Wood,
Riding Yi to command clouds.
Above, govern the Five Marchmounts,
Seal mounds and summon mountains.
Below, proclaim to the Nine Rivers,
Twelve water sources.
Erase the old ledgers,
Inscribe in the Jade Chapters.
Record my Perfected form,
Azure Emperor Lord,
Descend with me in azure radiance,
Flying azure feathered skirts,
Merge with the Emperor’s light,
Petition the Jade Dawn."*

Conclude by striking the teeth twelve times and swallowing saliva twenty-four times.

Practicing this for nine years enables one to inscribe talismans and cast them into mountains, summoning clouds and rain, obscuring the sky in darkness. Casting talismans into water causes dragons to rise from the depths. Among people, inscribing talismans on wood renders the script indelible, its characters growing ever brighter. Carrying the talisman while embracing a tree transforms the body into a mountain forest, guarded by twelve Immortal Officials of the Eastern Marchmount.

After eighteen years, one can ascend to the Upper Clarity in flight.

Revealing this method carelessly invokes ghostly soldiers as punishment, extending calamity to seven generations, and the body will perish in the river’s source.

**The Nine Qi Rank Talisman of Jia-Yi Entering Wood**
Inscribe in vermilion. On the day of *Lichun* at dawn, face east to ingest it, reciting the incantation as above.

Additionally, on the days of *Jia-yin* and *Yi-mao* in the first and second months, write in azure ink on paulownia wood, nine inches wide and twelve inches long. Bury it nine feet deep at the Eastern Marchmount of one’s dwelling. *Jia* and *Yi* occur only once a year; thus, perform this ritual once every three years, not annually. However, the visualization and ingestion should follow the seasonal nodes, and after nine years, the response will invariably descend.

This is also called the *White Feather Central Grove Flying Heaven Nine Talismans*, or the *Nine Transformations, Three Unions, Becoming One*. Those who behold its scripture attain the same Perfection as the Five Emperors.

On the day of burying the talisman, face east and strike the teeth thirty-six times. Visualize azure *qi* clouds crowning a mountain, filling the space above and below in dense obscurity.

The Lord of the Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai, rides a nine-colored dragon, wielding a jade-green feathered banner, accompanied by twelve Immortal Officials of Mount Tai. Within the azure *qi*, they oversee and reflect upon the adept’s body. Recite while looking upward:

*"Heaven communicates with earthly principles,
The two *qi* merge with the Perfected.
Nine crimson yang luminaries,
Four seasons unfold in order.
Above, the Five Emperors open,
The Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai.
Below, proclaim to the myriad spirits,
The boundless deities.
Expunge my past transgressions,
Record this chapter of mine.
Eradicate demonic trials,
Enable my ascension as an Immortal.
Bestow honors upon the numinous Marchmount,
Merge with *qi* in mist.
Summon clouds and descend rain,
Fly through azure skies in a chariot.
Ascend into the Mysterious Void,
Before the August Emperor."*

Conclude by burying the talisman as prescribed, then draw in and swallow the azure *qi* thirty-six times.

The Lord of the Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai, regularly on the day of *Chunfen* (Spring Equinox), presents the registers of Perfected Immortals who have attained the Dao and those newly studying it, reporting to the August Emperor Lord on High to review the Mysterious Names.

To cultivate the Dao of Flying Immortals, on that day at the hour of *Chen* (7–9 AM), bathe, fast, burn incense, and enter the chamber. Face east and visualize the Lord of the Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai: surnamed Xuanqiu, personal name Mulu, wearing the Three Treasures Nine Radiance Night Crown, clad in azure feathered skirts and a nine-colored patterned robe, bearing the Supreme August Life-Spirit Seal. He rides a flying chariot of azure clouds drawn by nine azure dragons, accompanied by twelve Immortal Officials, each holding the Five Sacred Fungi. They circle northeast, ascending to the boundless heights of the Jade Clarity Heaven, wandering within the azure clouds of the Mysterious Void.

Recite while striking the teeth nine times:

*"Today, at the supreme seasonal node,
Eight vows unfold anew.
May the divine melody revolve,
Descend to my realm.
Receive my supplications,
Present my petitions.
Inscribe my name in the Jade Registers,
Rank me in the Purple Chapters.
May the Dao Lord reflect upon me,
That I attain Upper Immortality."*

Conclude the visualization as the Lord of Mount Tai descends in his chariot, azure *qi* billowing densely to fill the chamber. He stands within the azure *qi*, holding a green bamboo slip, inscribing the adept’s name upon it. Softly recite:

*"Jade Perfected wandering,
Radiant in the East.
Riding dragons, driving chariots,
Flying through the Great Void.
Revolving numinous melodies,
Descend to my chamber.
Azure yang proclaims the beginning,
Supreme vows unfold.
Receive my petitions,
Expunge transgressions, record merits.
Inscribe my name on the green bamboo slip,
Present it to the August Emperor.
The Western Tortoise binds the records,
The Eastern Flower engraves the directions.
Five Numinous Ones assist,
Eight Emperors shine together.
Bearing Jia, riding Yi,
Exiting Wood to enter emptiness.
Six Ding spirits attend,
Jade maidens support.
Command mountains, summon seas,
Govern dragons.
Whistle to summon wind, raise clouds,
All obeys instantly.
Heavenly demons submit to trials,
Myriad spirits revere and follow.
Transform the luminous body,
Ascend to the Jade Palace.
Yearly offerings at Mount Tai,
Eternal preservation without end."*

When finished, raise the head and swallow the nine qi to conclude.

After nine years of cultivation, the Lord of Mount Tai will manifest before the practitioner, descending upon clouds of azure qi, bestowing nine divine youths and naturally occurring spirit-mushrooms, enabling knowledge of affairs ten thousand *li* to the east. After eighteen years, one attains a dragon chariot, riding the void to ascend to the Jade Pure Palace.

**Southern Marchmount’s Red Emperor: Internal Contemplation of Bing-Ding Entering Fire, Three Qi Mottled Talisman**
The Red Emperor of the South, surnamed Yan, personal name Dongdan, wears a precious crown of three qi and dark beams, a crimson cloud-brocade robe with cinnabar-patterned skirts, bears the Southern Culmen’s talisman for restraining yang, and girds the Eight Radiance Sword of the Vermilion Palace. On the day of *Lixia* (Beginning of Summer), he rides a chariot of scarlet mist-wheels, accompanied by twelve Jade Maidens of Great Cinnabar, each mounted on nine-colored phoenixes and holding the three qi blossoms of solar essence. They roam Mount Heng of the Southern Marchmount, reviewing the registers of perfected ones and immortals, as well as the names of learners, then proceed to the Water Emperor and Divine King of the Southern Sea to audit the merits, transgressions, and faults of those who study the Dao. Upon returning, they descend to the bodies of those who bear the talisman.

Learners who ingest this talisman summon its spirit, visualize its qi to draw down its authenticity, erase their names from the Water Emperor’s records, and inscribe them in the jade registers. At high noon on *Lixia*, bathe, purify, and fast, then enter the chamber to burn incense. Ingest the Bing-Ding Entering Fire Three Qi Mottled Talisman, knock the teeth thrice, and visualize the Red Emperor’s personal name and attire, his scarlet mist-wheel chariot descending into one’s chamber. Scarlet qi blazes, filling the room and encircling one’s form. Visualize the Emperor within the scarlet qi transforming into the Radiant Deluder Star, its brilliance illuminating as it descends from the crown of the head into the body, its light pervading the heart’s palace. Draw in qi and swallow thrice, feeling the body suffused with warmth. Soon, the Radiant Deluder Star disperses from the heart into scarlet qi, exiting through the nine orifices and reuniting above the crown to form a scarlet cloud. Sense the body within this cloud, ascending with it. After a long while, the perception stabilizes, as if treading emptiness. Raise the head and pray:

*"Three qi return to the origin,
Soaring to the Nine Purities of Heaven.
White feathers in the central grove,
Entering the subtle and numinous.
Girded with Bing’s radiance,
Riding fire to enter Ding.
Central perfection merges as one,
Transforming into the luminous star above.
Commanding the ten thousand qi,
Sealing mountains and summoning spirits.
Talismans bind the nine rivers,
Twelve water spirits.
Erasing the nine yin,
Names from the old registers.
Raising clouds, descending dragons,
Crimson chariots of the cinnabar heavens.
Eight effulgences swiftly traverse the void,
Flowing fire darkens the gloom.
Flying wheels and purple canopies,
Convey my form,
Treading the void, stepping the floating.
Ascending to the Jade Court,
Receiving refinement in the Cavern Yang.
Five spirits shine brightly,
Eternally enjoying celestial longevity,
Merging with the Emperor."*

When finished, knock the teeth nine times and swallow saliva twelve times to conclude.

After nine years of practice, one can inscribe talismans and cast them into forests, which spontaneously ignite; cast them into water, and dragons surface; cast them into mountains, and clouds and rain descend. Bearing the talisman, one enters fire unscathed. Burying it at the Southern Marchmount secures immortal officials to attend and guard the body. After eighteen years, one can fly and ascend to the Jade Pure Palace.

Revealing this Dao lightly brings calamity upon seven generations, consigning the body to the offices of ghosts, eternally confined in earth prisons, barred from attaining immortality.

**The Supreme Bing-Ding Entering Fire Three Qi Mottled Talisman** is written in vermilion. Ingest it at high noon on *Lixia*, facing south, with prayers as above. Additionally, on *Bingwu* or *Dingwei* days in the fourth or fifth month, write it in vermilion on paulownia wood, eight *cun* wide and one *chi* two *cun* long, and bury it eight *chi* deep at the Southern Marchmount of one’s dwelling. *Bing* and *Ding* share a single day; perform this burial once every three years, not annually. Merely visualizing, ingesting, and practicing according to the seasons for nine years will ensure the Red Emperor and the Lord of Mount Heng manifest before the practitioner.

This is called the **Threefold Union Attaining Dao Nine Perfected Middle Talisman**, also known as the **Ninefold Union Entering Subtle Dark Void Seven Transformations**. Those who behold its script attain the perfection of the Five Emperors and ascend as immortals.

When burying the talisman, face south, knock the teeth twenty-four times, and visualize scarlet qi clouds crowning a mountain. The Lord of Mount Heng of the Southern Marchmount rides a cloud chariot drawn by scarlet dragons, holding a vermilion feathered tally, accompanied by twelve immortals of Mount Heng within the scarlet qi, overseeing the practitioner’s body. Raise the head and pray:

*"Cinnabar numen, Cavern Yang,
Above governing Heaven’s Conjunction.
Nine transformations, three unions,
Thus forming the Dao’s palace.
Scarlet effulgent talisman,
Might ruling the ten thousand directions.
Today, the supreme tally,
Three qi open the passage.
Connecting the Five Emperors above,
Announcing the script to the numinous peak.
Erasing my past debts,
Inscribing my name in the August Emperor’s registers.
May my Dao be accomplished,
Transforming the mysterious void.
Sealing the numinous marchmounts,
Summoning the sea and commanding dragons.
Raising clouds, descending rain,
All directions instantly obey.
Flying through the heavens in scarlet wheels,
Ascending to the Emperor’s chamber.
Eight qi merge with effulgences,
Three origins shine together."*

When finished, bury the talisman as prescribed, then raise the head and swallow scarlet qi twenty-four times to conclude.

The Lord of Mount Heng of the Southern Marchmount, on the summer festival day, presents the registers of perfected immortals, those who have attained the Dao, and beginners to the Supreme Emperor, reviewing the mysterious names and distinguishing merits from faults.

To cultivate the Dao of flying immortality, at noon on that day, bathe, purify, and fast, then enter the chamber to burn incense. Face south and visualize the Lord of Mount Heng, surnamed Yan, personal name Yangguang, wearing an Eight Brilliances Precious Radiance Jade Crown, a crimson brocade flying skirt, and a divine radiance crimson-patterned robe, bearing the talisman for sealing spirits and restraining demons. He rides a scarlet mist flying wheel, accompanied by twelve immortals of the Southern Marchmount, each mounted on flying phoenixes and holding spirit-mushrooms. They circle the southeast, ascending to the boundless heights of the Jade Pure Heaven, roaming the void within scarlet clouds.

At this moment, strike the teeth three times and silently recite: "Today is most auspicious, the perfect hour for perfected beings. May the mysterious vow descend universally, renewing all beneath heaven. I beseech the Dao Lord to turn and send down the flying immortals, their feathered canopies descending upon my body. As the Dao Lord descends, I become an imperial minister, my name inscribed in the Upper Clarity, my destiny bound to the Eastern Flower."

When finished, visualize the Lord of Mount Heng riding his scarlet mist flying wheel, descending into your chamber. Crimson qi billows densely, filling the room. The Lord stands amidst the crimson qi, holding a vermilion tablet, inscribing your name upon its register. He softly intones:

"Vermilion guts ride the dawn, circling the Nine Heavens.
Cinnabar chariot and flying canopy, radiant through the rosy void.
Curving downward to illuminate, overseeing my heart’s devotion.
All vows I present shall move the unseen.
Unfurl the numinous guard, body and spirit in communion.
Inscribe my name on the Cinnabar Terrace, bind my script to Southern Jade.
Six Bing days escort the perfected, riding Ding to enter the whirlwind.
Command mountains and seal seas, restrain the myriad calamities.
A thousand spirits cower, all demons disperse.
As the Southern Marchmount is grasped, the Three Origins summon me.
Descend with the vermilion carriage, ascend into the imperial court.
The Three Luminaries unite in power, outlasting heaven’s decay."

When finished, raise your head and swallow the qi three times to conclude.

Practice this for nine years, and the Lord of Mount Heng will bestow upon you a treasure script, along with eight immortal officials, and grant rare spirit-mushrooms and wondrous objects, enabling you to know all affairs within ten thousand *li* of the south.

Practice for eighteen years, and you will attain the scarlet cloud wheel, soaring through the great void to ascend to the Jade Pure Palace.

The Divine King erases my sin register, inscribes my name in the immortal ledger, and presents it before the Jade Emperor.

Twelve imperial palaces, nine river lords,
Above governing the Jade Void, below presiding over the divine continent.
On this most auspicious day, the Divine King sets forth,
Holding my life’s register, guarding my mysterious talisman.
Returning true essence, bending light to descend to my dwelling,
Erasing my sin register, engraving it in celestial script.

Merging with primordial auspiciousness, my body one with the Emperor."*

After eighteen years of practice, I shall traverse the Western Sea, tread the ten-thousand-fathom abyss, with sea spirits guarding my passage, unbound by water’s constraints. A dragon carriage shall descend, soaring through the great void, while the water officials erase my sins and present my name to the Emperor. This Dao is lofty and wondrous, not practiced in the mundane world. Those who encounter this text shall attain immortality without study.

**Talisman of the Black Qi from the Northern Sea Water Emperor’s River Cavern**
The *Supreme River Cavern Black Qi Talisman* is to be inscribed in cinnabar on blue-green paper at midnight on the days of *Lidong* (Beginning of Winter) or *Dongzhi* (Winter Solstice), then ingested while facing north. *"Heaven and earth divide their streams, the four rivers govern clarity,
Three river water palaces, nine river imperial spirits.
Examining registers, binding sins to the Four Luminaries—
Those with Dao earn merit; those with transgressions face punishment.
On this most auspicious day, the Emperor’s light illumines my court.
Flowing true essence returns, descending—my immortality is achieved.
Three rivers and four seas guard my form,
A thousand transformations, ten thousand changes—spoken, they arise at once.
Soaring through the mysterious void, ascending to the Eight Darknesses,
Eternally preserving the Three Luminaries, heaven and earth in harmony."*

Conclude by swallowing breaths of qi, then cast the talisman into the northward-flowing abyss as prescribed. After eighteen years of practice, I shall ascend through the great void, traverse mountains and seas, with ten thousand spirits guarding my passage, attaining the subtle and entering the mysterious, uniting with the Emperor in true essence.

Upon completion, raise your head and swallow the eight breaths of qi to stillness, then cast the talisman into the northern abyss of the North Sea as prescribed. After eighteen years of practice, summon the twelve Water Lords and Jiao-Dragons to command the waters and raise clouds, darkening the bright day. Soaring through the void, ascend to the Jade Purity.

This method is most profound—only the true may practice it. To violate its prohibitions or recklessly transmit it brings calamity and annihilation to one’s person, extending punishment through the Seven Mysteries. It is the secret of immortals alone.

The Supreme Nine Crimson-Striped Talisman is formed by weaving the soaring, mysterious purple qi into its script. The Supreme Perfected Lord seals the mountains and summons the peaks, governing the rivers and commanding the spirits. Its script penetrates the subtle, resplendent in the Highest Clarity.

The Primordial Heavenly King concealed it within the Jade Terrace’s Golden Chamber of the Jade Void. By ancient decree, it is transmitted once every seven thousand years. Without a name inscribed in gold or jade, or the vermilion script of the Mystic Terrace, one may not partake of its teachings. Those who behold its script and perfect its practice attain the rank of Highest Immortal.

Within nine years, the immortal officials of the Five Peaks will attend and guard your person, the Water Emperor and water spirits will await your command from all directions, and the Five Emperors will report your name to the Mystic Palace. The water officials will erase your records of transgression, dragons will descend amidst clouds, and transformations will arise without limit.

You must also habitually inscribe the talisman in colored pigments and wear it upon your person. Ascend mountains and traverse rivers—then the myriad spirits will guard your form, vanquish demons and trials, subdue all spirits with your might, and five-colored clouds will descend to your chamber while purple mist arises of itself. A halo will encircle your head, illuminating within and without, the Eight Effulgences will unite in perfection, and the Three Primes will descend in chariots. Soaring through the mysterious void, you will ascend to the Jade Purity.

Those whose names are inscribed in gold and whose bones are of jade, bearing the precious script of the Highest Clarity, who obtain this talisman and wear it for three years, shall become Perfected Ones of the Five Peaks. Treading rivers and crossing seas, they shall become Lords of the Four Seas, assisted by the Five Emperors, revered by the myriad spirits. After nine years of practice, they shall traverse ten thousand fathoms of water, command and restrain the Jiao-Dragons, and if they retreat to the mountains to cultivate in seclusion, the Five Emperors and Five Peaks will manifest and converse with them. They shall summon clouds and raise rain, instantly call forth dragon mists, and achieve a thousand transformations and ten thousand changes, their responses instantaneous.

After eighteen years of practice, they shall soar to the Highest Clarity. This Dao is most profound and not to be revealed in the world. To lightly disclose its sacred script brings punishment upon the seven generations of ancestors, while one’s own life is forfeit, bound eternally to the offices of the dead.

The recipient must fast with their master for thirty days—or seven days—offering three taels of refined gold, fifty feet each of five-colored patterned silk, forty feet of brocade, and one catty of finest incense. They shall proceed to the cliffs of the Five Peaks, announce themselves to the Five Emperors, and register with the Five Spirits, the celestial, terrestrial, and water officials of the Three Rivers and Four Seas, in accordance with the oath of the Four Poles, before transmission may occur.

If the recipient fails to register with the Celestial Spirits, the jade lads and jade maidens who attend the script will report to the Most High, and the recipient shall be punished by the divine soldiers of the Five Emperors. Those who lightly disclose it shall be punished across nine generations of ancestors, their own person extinguished. Those who receive it without swearing the oath shall bring calamity upon seven generations of ancestors, their own body afflicted by wind and fire, and the script shall naturally be lost.

Thus did the Supreme Primordial Lady declare to the Five Emperors: a script not sworn to shall not be transmitted; one who receives without registration loses the true. Both parties bear the responsibility of life and death. Scholars must adhere to the text and uphold it.

The Dao descends without fail; immortality is achieved without exception. Life and death share in its blessings, and fortune flows to one’s kin. The sacred script is most weighty—this is the ultimate truth of the Dao.

Here ends the *Wondrous Perfected Supreme Nine Crimson-Striped Talisman: The Five Emperors’ Scripture of Inner Perfection*.

chunks.original_text: 洞真太上九赤班符五帝内真经 经名：洞真太上九赤班符五帝内真经。 简称《九赤班符》。 撰人不详，约出於东晋。 系早期上清派重要经典。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》正一部。 洞真太上九赤班符五帝内真经 九赤班符，一名羽中林飞天九符。 元始天王藏之於上清瑶台金房玉室之中，神真焕明，流光曜空，四极监试，五帝卫真。 太上以云宫玉童三百人、上元又以西华玉女七百人，侍典灵文。 神标上清，威严九天，制魔灭祓，馘斩群凶，封掌名山，摄召水神，总统亿亿，领括万仙，五岳四渍及后学者身，部以神兵，罚过赏功。 九千年则九天一开，九天开，其文则明五岳之室，玄授得道之人。 自无仙骨玉名，刻书来生，不得见其篇目。 有得其文，便为五岳之师宗，四海之君王。 奉之者庆延七祖之魂，福流九种之亲，修之者刻成上清高仙真人。 九赤者，乃九元之炁飞玄羽章，结成玉文。 元文人以传太上大道君，元始天王以传南极上元君，太上以传扶桑大帝，太帝以传太微天帝君，太微天帝君以传后圣金阙帝君，以传上相青童君，南极上元君以传洪崖先生、太极四真人。 炁炁相传，皆刻书金简，结以紫篇，盛以云锦之囊，封以三元之章，藏以郁森之笈，秘於九曲之房。 玉仙典香，太华执巾，四司监映，五帝卫轩，三元晏礼，万仙朝真，其道至妙，依科七千年一传。 轻泄宣露，传非其人，七祖获考，身没河源。 后学勤心苦思，求仙精诚，感於太虚冥德，合於三元玄挺，应会自得此文，得佩真符，始可涉历於玄岳，托身於幽山，役九赤以封丘，命五行以招神，俾水帝以削罪，摄海灵以通源，则罪籍灭落於九府，生录刻注於三清，炁震溟波，威摄万灵，群魔灭试，仙官降形，运策六甲，制御天丁，通幽彻微，逆睹未生，故能神仙，飞行上清。 夫学不见九赤白羽中林飞天九符，则五岳不领玄名，四海水神不为兆削灭罪简，勒注三清也。 游行川泽，隐居幽山，不佩此文，则山灵天魔试败其旨，万害自生，终不成仙，水帝结书，列罪帝君也。 五岳五帝内思变化真形求仙上法 凡入东岳，思东方青帝神，闭眼即见真形者，其人则五宫结气，六藏生真，九府洞朗，内无滞根，和音震响，妙理明通，此人皆上仙之才也。 故道为之即降，神明为之感会，则仙不移年而成也。 若见青炁郁郁，亦其方正神虚映之炁也，则道有渐也。 若见黑气，则上真本生之号虚映之官，监试於兆身。 若见赤气，则洞生之官虚映之炁，来卫兆身也。 若见黄炁，则岳所使之官虚映之炁，来给兆通真也。 此悉无怪，依本而行事，久久道自感而降焉。 若见白炁，则天魔空中之精，来干试兆身，当叩左齿三十六通，而诵金玄章之祝一遍，则魔精自灭，真自来降也。 凡入南岳，思南方赤帝神，闭眼即见真形者，其人则骨结玉霜，炁参神宫，丹台刻简，结录紫篇，幽悟冥涂，逸浪虚庭，触类无滞，静思感真，此人皆上仙之才。 故道为之即降，神明为之感会也。 如此则仙不移年而成。 若见赤炁，亦其方正神虚映之炁也，则道有渐也。 若见青炁，则上真本生之号虚映之官，来监试於兆身。 若见黄炁，则洞生之号虚映之官，来卫兆身。 若见白炁，则南岳所使之官虚映之炁，来结兆身通真也。

**The Supreme Cavern-Real Scripture of the Nine Crimson Talismans and the Five Emperors’ Inner Realms**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Cavern-Real Scripture of the Nine Crimson Talismans and the Five Emperors’ Inner Realms* (abbreviated as *The Nine Crimson Talismans*). Author unknown, approximately composed during the Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational scripture of the early Shangqing tradition. One fascicle. Base text from *The Orthodox Daoist Canon*, Zhengyi Section, First Division.

---

**The Supreme Cavern-Real Scripture of the Nine Crimson Talismans and the Five Emperors’ Inner Realms**

The Nine Crimson Talismans, also called the *Nine Aerial Talismans of the Feathered Central Grove*, were concealed by the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning within the Golden Chamber and Jade Abode of the Jasper Terrace of Supreme Clarity. Their divine radiance blazes forth, streaming light that illumines the void; the Four Poles oversee their trial, and the Five Emperors guard their authenticity.

The Supreme Lord appointed three hundred Jade Lads of the Cloud Palace, while the Upper Prime further assigned seven hundred Jade Maidens of the Western Florescence to attend and preserve this numinous writ. Its divine standard marks Supreme Clarity, its majesty commands the Nine Heavens; it subdues demons and dispels defilement, beheads legions of malevolence, seals and governs the sacred mountains, summons and commands the spirits of waters. It oversees boundless multitudes, encompasses the myriad immortals, and with the Five Peaks, the Four Abysses, and the bodies of later disciples, it deploys divine soldiers to punish transgressions and reward merit.

Every nine thousand years, the Nine Heavens open once; when the Nine Heavens open, this scripture illuminates the chambers of the Five Peaks, mysteriously bestowed upon those who attain the Dao. Without immortal bones or jade names inscribed for future lives, none may behold its passages. Those who obtain its text become masters and patriarchs of the Five Peaks, sovereigns of the Four Seas. Those who uphold it bring blessings to the souls of seven generations of ancestors and spread fortune to nine kinds of kin. Those who cultivate it ascend to become lofty immortals of Supreme Clarity.

The Nine Crimson Talismans are the flying, mysterious feathered chapters of the *qi* of the Nine Primes, coalesced into jade script. The primordial text was transmitted by the human realm to the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao; the Celestial Worthy of Primordial Beginning transmitted it to the Upper Prime Lord of the Southern Culmen; the Supreme Lord transmitted it to the Great Emperor of Fusang; the Great Emperor transmitted it to the Celestial Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity; the Celestial Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity transmitted it to the Later Sage Emperor of the Golden Portals; and thence to the Prime Minister, the Azure Lad. The Upper Prime Lord of the Southern Culmen transmitted it to Master Hongya and the Four Perfected of the Great Ultimate.

Transmission of *qi* follows in succession, each inscribed on golden tablets, bound with purple cords, encased in cloud-brocade satchels, sealed with the seals of the Three Primes, stored in dark and verdant caskets, and concealed within the chambers of the Nine Bends. Jade immortals offer incense, Mount Taihua holds the towels; the Four Directors oversee its radiance, the Five Emperors guard its carriage. The Three Primes observe the rites, the myriad immortals pay homage to the Perfected. Its Dao is most wondrous; according to the regulations, it is transmitted once every seven thousand years. To lightly divulge or expose it, or transmit it to the unworthy, brings the seven generations of ancestors to trial and causes the disciple’s body to perish in the river’s source.

Later disciples who diligently concentrate their minds, seek immortality with utmost sincerity, and resonate with the dark virtue of the Great Void, aligning with the mysterious emergence of the Three Primes, will naturally encounter and obtain this text. Only upon receiving and wearing the true talismans may one traverse the mysterious peaks, entrust one’s body to the secluded mountains, command the Nine Crimson to seal the mounds, summon the Five Agents to invoke spirits, dispatch the Water Emperor to erase transgressions, and gather the numina of the seas to open the sources. Thus, the ledgers of sins are obliterated in the Nine Treasuries, and the records of life are inscribed in the Three Clarities. *Qi* shakes the dark waves, majesty subdues the myriad spirits; demonic hosts are vanquished in trial, immortal officials descend in form. Wielding the tally of the Six Jia, one commands the celestial soldiers; penetrating the obscure and fathoming the subtle, one perceives the yet-unborn. Thus may one attain divine transcendence and soar through Supreme Clarity.

Those who study without encountering the *Nine Aerial Talismans of the Feathered Central Grove* will not receive the mysterious names of the Five Peaks, nor will the water spirits of the Four Seas erase their ledgers of sins or inscribe their names in the Three Clarities. When wandering through rivers and marshes or dwelling in secluded mountains without wearing this text, mountain spirits and celestial demons will test and thwart their aspirations, myriad harms will arise of themselves, and they will never attain immortality. The Water Emperor will compile their transgressions and present them to the Emperor of Judgment.

---

**The Five Peaks’ Five Emperors’ Inner Method of Transforming True Forms to Seek Immortality**

When entering the Eastern Peak, visualize the Azure Emperor of the East. If upon closing the eyes one immediately perceives his true form, that person’s five palaces will coalesce *qi*, the six viscera will generate the Perfected, the nine treasuries will become luminously clear, and internally, no obstructions will remain. Harmonious tones will resound, and wondrous principles will become lucid and penetrating—such a person possesses the talent of a superior immortal. Thus, the Dao will descend at once, and divine luminaries will respond in resonance; such a one will attain immortality without delay.

If one sees azure *qi* flourishing and dense, it is the *qi* of the upright spirit of that direction, reflecting in emptiness—this indicates gradual progress on the Dao. If one sees black *qi*, it is the office of the Perfected of one’s original life reflecting in emptiness, overseeing the trial of one’s body. If one sees red *qi*, it is the *qi* of the office of cavernous generation reflecting in emptiness, coming to guard one’s body. If one sees yellow *qi*, it is the *qi* of the office dispatched by the Peak reflecting in emptiness, coming to assist one in communicating with the Perfected. None of these should be feared; proceed according to the original method, and in time, the Dao will naturally respond and descend.

If one sees white *qi*, it is the essence of celestial demons in the void, coming to test one’s body. One should strike the left teeth thirty-six times and recite the *Golden Mystery Chapter* once; then the demonic essence will vanish of itself, and the Perfected will naturally descend.

When entering the Southern Peak, visualize the Vermilion Emperor of the South. If upon closing the eyes one immediately perceives his true form, that person’s bones will coalesce jade frost, *qi* will interpenetrate the divine palace, the cinnabar terrace will inscribe the tablets, and the purple chapters will be bound into records. Profoundly awakened to the dark path, one roams freely in the empty courtyard, encounters all things without obstruction, and through tranquil contemplation, resonates with the Perfected—such a person possesses the talent of a superior immortal. Thus, the Dao will descend at once, and divine luminaries will respond in resonance; such a one will attain immortality without delay.

If one sees red *qi*, it is the *qi* of the upright spirit of that direction reflecting in emptiness—this indicates gradual progress on the Dao. If one sees azure *qi*, it is the office of the Perfected of one’s original life reflecting in emptiness, coming to oversee the trial of one’s body. If one sees yellow *qi*, it is the office of cavernous generation reflecting in emptiness, coming to guard one’s body. If one sees white *qi*, it is the *qi* of the office dispatched by the Southern Peak reflecting in emptiness, coming to assist one’s body in communicating with the Perfected.

chunks.original_text: 东岳青帝内思甲乙入木九炁班符 东方青帝君，姓常，讳精萌，头建九元通天冠，衣青锦帔碧饰飞裙，佩太上九炁命灵之章，带翠羽交灵之绶。 常以立春之日，乘碧霞九龙云舆，从青腰玉女十二人，手把青林之华九色杖幡，游行东岳太山，校定真人仙官录札，时诣东海水帝，考算学道功过罪目，回降佩符者身。 学者服其符以招其人，存其炁以降其真，求削水帝之简，上名玉札之篇。 当以立春之日平旦，沐浴斋静，入室烧香，服甲乙入木九炁班符，叩齿九通，思东方青帝君，姓常，讳精萌，衣服形色，乘碧霞云舆，下降兆房，青炁郁郁，覆满一室，冠匝己形。 存见帝君青炁之中化为赤光，如岁星之精，赫赫照明，从头顶而下，入兆身中，光明洞映肝部之间。 便引炁九咽，觉身中熏热，须臾，赤光於内散，从九孔中出，回合还兆头顶之上，化成青云，觉兆身在青云之中，随云而升。 良久觉定，豁如蹈空，便仰咒曰： 太丹亿斋，回合九门，玄虚举真，赤班早分，带甲入木，乘乙御云，上制五岳，封丘召山，下告九河，十二水源，落除宿简，列奏玉篇，掌录我真，青帝之君，降我碧霞，飞青羽裙，与帝合景，奏谒玉晨。 毕，又叩齿十二通，咽液二十四遍止。 行之九年，则能书符投山，山降云雨，鲦欻晻冥，书符投水，水上蛟龙，能入万丈之渊。 如行人中，书符於木，削之不灭，其文转明，带符抱木，身成山林，东岳卫以仙官十二人。 一十八年，则能飞行上清。 轻泄此道，罚以鬼兵，殃延七祖，身没河源。 太上甲乙入木九炁班符，朱书，立春之日平旦，东向服之，祝如上法。 又以正月、二月甲寅、乙卯之日，青书桐板之上，令广九寸，长一尺二寸，埋之所住东岳，令深九尺。 甲乙唯一日也，如此法三年一埋，不必年年也。 但存思服御，依节行之，亦九年无不感降也。 此一名白羽中林飞天九符，一名九变三合成一，得见其文，与五帝同真。 埋符之日，当东向叩齿三十六通，存思青炁之云，覆冠一山，上下郁冥。 东岳太山君，乘九色之龙，手执青羽之麾，从太山仙官十二人，在青炁之内监映兆身，仰祝曰： 天通地理，二炁交真，九赤阳明，四度开陈，上开五帝，东岳泰山，下告万灵，无鞅之神，削我宿对，记我此篇，灭消魔试，使我成仙，封赏灵岳，与炁同烟，兴云降雨，飞霄碧轩，升入玄虚，高皇帝前。 毕，埋符如式，仰引青炁三十六咽止。 东岳泰山君，常以春分之日，列奏真仙已得道及始学之人名录，上言高上帝君，检校玄名。 修飞仙之道，当以其日日之时，沐浴斋戒，烧香入室，东向思东岳泰山君，姓玄丘，讳目陆，头建三宝九光夜冠，衣青羽章裙，披九色班裘，带上皇命神之篆，乘青云飞舆九色苍龙，从十二仙官，手把五芝，东北而回，上登无崖之上玉清之天，徘徊玄虚之内青云之中。 当叩齿九通，心言：今日上节，八愿开新，愿回神曲，来降我间，纳我所求，奏我所陈，得上玉札，位系紫篇，道君回映，我获上仙。 毕，思泰山君乘舆下降，青炁郁郁，覆满一室，君处青炁之中，手执青简，注上我名於青简之篇，微祝曰： 玉真徘徊，焕明东方，乘龙驾舆，飞行太空，回灵曲映，下降我房，青阳告始，上愿开通，纳我所陈，削过记功，刻名青简，列奏高皇，西龟结录，东华勒方，五灵辅翼，八帝齐光，来甲御乙，出木入空，六丁侍卫，玉女扶将，摄山召海，命制蛟龙，啸风兴云，靡不立躬，天魔伏试，万灵敬从，变景化形，上升玉宫，年享泰山，永保无穷。

**The Nine Qi Rank Talisman of the Azure Emperor of the Eastern Marchmount, with Inner Visualization of Jia-Yi Entering Wood**

The Azure Emperor Lord of the East, surnamed Chang, personal name Jingmeng, wears the Nine Origins Heaven-Penetrating Crown upon his head. His robe is of azure brocade with jade-green flying skirts, and he bears the Supreme Nine Qi Life-Spirit Seal. His sash is woven of kingfisher plumes and interlaced with numinous cords.

On the day of *Lichun* (Beginning of Spring), he rides a cloud-chariot drawn by nine azure dragons, accompanied by twelve Jade Maidens of the Azure Waist, each holding a nine-colored staff and banner of the Azure Grove. He traverses the Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai, reviewing the registers of Perfected Ones and Immortal Officials. At times, he visits the Water Emperor of the Eastern Sea to audit the merits, transgressions, and sins of those who study the Dao. Upon his return, he descends to bestow talismans upon the adept’s body.

The practitioner ingests this talisman to summon his presence, visualizes his *qi* to induce the descent of his Perfected form, and seeks to have their name expunged from the Water Emperor’s ledgers and inscribed in the Jade Registers.

On the day of *Lichun* at dawn, bathe, purify, and enter the chamber to burn incense. Ingest the *Nine Qi Rank Talisman of Jia-Yi Entering Wood*, strike the teeth nine times, and visualize the Azure Emperor Lord of the East: surnamed Chang, personal name Jingmeng, clad in his robes and colors, descending in his azure-cloud chariot into the adept’s chamber. Azure *qi* billows densely, filling the room and encircling the adept’s form.

Within the Azure Emperor’s *qi*, visualize a crimson radiance transforming, like the essence of Jupiter, blazing and luminous. It descends from the crown of the head into the adept’s body, its brilliance illuminating the liver. Draw in the *qi* and swallow nine times, sensing warmth suffusing the body. Soon, the crimson light scatters within and emerges from the nine orifices, coalescing above the adept’s head into azure clouds. The adept feels their body within the clouds, ascending with them.

After a long while, the perception stabilizes, as if treading empty space. Then recite the incantation while looking upward:

*"Supreme Cinnabar, myriad purifications,
Revolving to seal the nine gates.
Mysterious Void uplifts the Perfected,
Crimson ranks swiftly divide.
Bearing Jia to enter Wood,
Riding Yi to command clouds.
Above, govern the Five Marchmounts,
Seal mounds and summon mountains.
Below, proclaim to the Nine Rivers,
Twelve water sources.
Erase the old ledgers,
Inscribe in the Jade Chapters.
Record my Perfected form,
Azure Emperor Lord,
Descend with me in azure radiance,
Flying azure feathered skirts,
Merge with the Emperor’s light,
Petition the Jade Dawn."*

Conclude by striking the teeth twelve times and swallowing saliva twenty-four times.

Practicing this for nine years enables one to inscribe talismans and cast them into mountains, summoning clouds and rain, obscuring the sky in darkness. Casting talismans into water causes dragons to rise from the depths. Among people, inscribing talismans on wood renders the script indelible, its characters growing ever brighter. Carrying the talisman while embracing a tree transforms the body into a mountain forest, guarded by twelve Immortal Officials of the Eastern Marchmount.

After eighteen years, one can ascend to the Upper Clarity in flight.

Revealing this method carelessly invokes ghostly soldiers as punishment, extending calamity to seven generations, and the body will perish in the river’s source.

**The Nine Qi Rank Talisman of Jia-Yi Entering Wood**
Inscribe in vermilion. On the day of *Lichun* at dawn, face east to ingest it, reciting the incantation as above.

Bury it nine feet deep at the Eastern Marchmount of one’s dwelling. *Jia* and *Yi* occur only once a year; thus, perform this ritual once every three years, not annually. However, the visualization and ingestion should follow the seasonal nodes, and after nine years, the response will invariably descend.

On the day of burying the talisman, face east and strike the teeth thirty-six times. Visualize azure *qi* clouds crowning a mountain, filling the space above and below in dense obscurity.

The Lord of the Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai, rides a nine-colored dragon, wielding a jade-green feathered banner, accompanied by twelve Immortal Officials of Mount Tai. Within the azure *qi*, they oversee and reflect upon the adept’s body. Recite while looking upward:

The two *qi* merge with the Perfected.
Nine crimson yang luminaries,
Four seasons unfold in order.
Above, the Five Emperors open,
The Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai.
Below, proclaim to the myriad spirits,
The boundless deities.
Expunge my past transgressions,
Record this chapter of mine.
Eradicate demonic trials,
Enable my ascension as an Immortal.
Bestow honors upon the numinous Marchmount,
Merge with *qi* in mist.
Summon clouds and descend rain,
Fly through azure skies in a chariot.
Ascend into the Mysterious Void,
Before the August Emperor."*

Conclude by burying the talisman as prescribed, then draw in and swallow the azure *qi* thirty-six times.

The Lord of the Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai, regularly on the day of *Chunfen* (Spring Equinox), presents the registers of Perfected Immortals who have attained the Dao and those newly studying it, reporting to the August Emperor Lord on High to review the Mysterious Names.

Face east and visualize the Lord of the Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai: surnamed Xuanqiu, personal name Mulu, wearing the Three Treasures Nine Radiance Night Crown, clad in azure feathered skirts and a nine-colored patterned robe, bearing the Supreme August Life-Spirit Seal. He rides a flying chariot of azure clouds drawn by nine azure dragons, accompanied by twelve Immortal Officials, each holding the Five Sacred Fungi. They circle northeast, ascending to the boundless heights of the Jade Clarity Heaven, wandering within the azure clouds of the Mysterious Void.

Descend to my realm.

Present my petitions.

Rank me in the Purple Chapters.

That I attain Upper Immortality."*

Conclude the visualization as the Lord of Mount Tai descends in his chariot, azure *qi* billowing densely to fill the chamber. He stands within the azure *qi*, holding a green bamboo slip, inscribing the adept’s name upon it. Softly recite:

Flying through the Great Void.
Revolving numinous melodies,
Descend to my chamber.

Expunge transgressions, record merits.
Inscribe my name on the green bamboo slip,
Present it to the August Emperor.
The Western Tortoise binds the records,
The Eastern Flower engraves the directions.
Five Numinous Ones assist,
Eight Emperors shine together.
Bearing Jia, riding Yi,
Exiting Wood to enter emptiness.
Six Ding spirits attend,
Jade maidens support.
Command mountains, summon seas,
Govern dragons.
Whistle to summon wind, raise clouds,
All obeys instantly.
Heavenly demons submit to trials,
Myriad spirits revere and follow.
Transform the luminous body,
Ascend to the Jade Palace.
Yearly offerings at Mount Tai,
Eternal preservation without end."*

Thus did the Supreme Primordial Lady declare to the Five Emperors: a script not sworn to shall not be transmitted; one who receives without registration loses the true. Both parties bear the responsibility of life and death. Scholars must adhere to the text and uphold it.

The Dao descends without fail; immortality is achieved without exception. Life and death share in its blessings, and fortune flows to one’s kin. The sacred script is most weighty—this is the ultimate truth of the Dao.

Here ends the *Wondrous Perfected Supreme Nine Crimson-Striped Talisman: The Five Emperors’ Scripture of Inner Perfection*.
